fields.description:
If a user tries to create an EBS-backed EMI from an instance that is based on an EBS-backed EMI that is registered with the root device name of /dev/vda, the following error is presented:
{code}
$ euca-run-instances -k account1-user01 -t m1.medium emi-340A50C9 --region account1-user01@
euca-run-instances: error (RunInstancesType): Root block device mapping not found
{code}

The following is a list of steps to reproduce this issue:
* Set up Eucalyptus 3.4.1 Cloud
* Download and source credentials as admin user of eucalyptus account:
{code}
$ euca-get-credentials -a eucalyptus -u admin admin.zip
$ unzip admin.zip
$ source eucarc
{code}
*  Download tar-gzipped precise-server-cloudimg:
{code}
$ wget http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/precise/current/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz
{code}
* Create an instance stored-backed EMI using eustore:
{code}
$ eustore-install-image -t precise-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz -b ubuntu-latest-precise-x86_64 --hypervisor universal -s "Ubuntu Cloud Image - Precise Pangolin - 12.04 LTS"
{code}
* Run instance using that EMI:
{code}
$ euca-run-instances -t m1.medium -k account1-user01 emi-5C8C3909
{code}
* Create a volume based upon the size of how big you want the root filesystem to be:
{code}
$ euca-create-volume -s 6 -z LayinDaSmackDown
{code}
* Attach the volume to the running instance:
{code}
$ euca-attach-volume -d /dev/vdd -i i-839E3FB0 vol-B5863B3B
{code}
* SSH into the instance and download the Ubuntu Precise Cloud Image (qcow2 format):
{code}
$ ssh -i account1-user01.priv ubuntu@euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
# sudo -s
# wget http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/precise/current/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img
{code}
* Install qemu-utils
{code}
# apt-get install -y qemu-utils
{code}
* Convert image from qcow2 to raw:
{code}
# qemu-img convert -O raw precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1-raw.img
{code}
* dd raw image to block device where volume is attached (use dmesg to figure that out easily):
{code}
# dmesg | tail
[ 7026.943212] virtio-pci 0000:00:05.0: using default PCI settings
[ 7026.943249] pci 0000:00:07.0: no hotplug settings from platform
[ 7026.943251] pci 0000:00:07.0: using default PCI settings
[ 7026.945964] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: enabling device (0000 -> 0003)
[ 7026.955143] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: PCI INT A -> Link[LNKC] -> GSI 10 (level, high) -> IRQ 10
[ 7026.955180] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: setting latency timer to 64
[ 7026.955429] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: irq 45 for MSI/MSI-X
[ 7026.955456] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: irq 46 for MSI/MSI-X
[ 7026.986990]  vdb: unknown partition table
[10447.093426] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: PCI INT A disabled

# dd if=/mnt/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1-raw.img of=/dev/vdb bs=1M
{code}
* Log out the instance, and detach the volume:
{code}
$ euca-detach-volume vol-B5863B3B
{code}
* Create a snapshot of the volume:
{code}
$ euca-create-snapshot vol-B5863B3B
{code}
* Register the snapshot to create the EBS-backed EMI (with /dev/vda):
{code}
$ euca-register --name ebs-precise-raw-vda --snapshot snap-EFDB40A1 --root-device-name /dev/vda --region account1-user01@
IMAGE	emi-A4A341F0
{code}
* Launch an instance using that EMI; check block device mapping:
{code}
$ euca-run-instances -k account1-user01 -t m1.medium emi-A4A341F0 --region account1-user01@
RESERVATION	r-71423F85	961915002812	default
INSTANCE	i-060940A9	emi-A4A341F0	euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal	pending	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-02-06T14:59:17.560Z	LayinDaSmackDown				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs					hvm
...
$ euca-describe-instances --region account1-user01@ i-060940A9
RESERVATION	r-71423F85	961915002812	default
INSTANCE	i-060940A9	emi-A4A341F0	euca-10-104-7-11.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-17-126-187.eucalyptus.internal	running	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-02-06T14:59:17.560Z	LayinDaSmackDown				monitoring-disabled	10.104.7.11	172.17.126.187			ebs					hvm
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/vda	vol-5F614299	2014-02-06T14:59:17.863Z	true

$ ssh -i account1-user01.priv ubuntu@euca-10-104-7-11.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com

ubuntu@euca-172-17-126-187:~$ sudo lsblk
NAME   MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
vda    253:0    0   6G  0 disk
└─vda1 253:1    0   6G  0 part /

ubuntu@euca-172-17-126-187:~$ df -ah
Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
/dev/vda1       6.0G  789M  4.9G  14% /
proc               0     0     0    - /proc
sysfs              0     0     0    - /sys
none               0     0     0    - /sys/fs/fuse/connections
none               0     0     0    - /sys/kernel/debug
none               0     0     0    - /sys/kernel/security
udev            494M  8.0K  494M   1% /dev
devpts             0     0     0    - /dev/pts
tmpfs           200M  208K  199M   1% /run
none            5.0M     0  5.0M   0% /run/lock
none            498M     0  498M   0% /run/shm

$ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/block-device-mapping/root
/dev/vda
{code}
* Run euca-create-image from the running EBS-backed instance:
{code}
$ euca-create-image -n ebs-precise-raw-vda-test i-060940A9 --region account1-user01@
IMAGE	emi-340A50C9

$ euca-describe-images emi-340A50C9 --region account1-user01@
IMAGE	emi-340A50C9	961915002812/ebs-precise-raw-vda-test	961915002812	available	private	x86_64	machine				ebs	hvm
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/vda	snap-068740BF	6	true
{code}
* Try to run an instance from this EMI, observe the error:
{code}
$ euca-run-instances -k account1-user01 -t m1.medium emi-340A50C9 --region account1-user01@
euca-run-instances: error (RunInstancesType): Root block device mapping not found
{code}
fields.summary: Fail to launch EBS-backed instance based on an instance registered with /dev/vda

comments.body: create image now updates EMI with correct root block device name.
